126.heading: Television.
126.title: "Secreto"
126.author: argumento de Yolanda Vargas Dulché ; dibujo de Sixto Valencia
notes: SUMMARY: A bunch of boys taunts Carlos, saying his mother doesn't realy work the night shift in a factory. After all, why does she dress so well? She's out dancing for money in a cabaret, they say. Carlos comes out swinging, and Memín happens by to join in the fray. Afterwards, Memín follows Carlos home, and sees him crying. Carlos tells him to go away and watch Ricardo's television with Ernesto, and not say anything, but Memín spills the beans. Soon the three friends are back to hear Carlos's story. Carlos plans to spend the night going around to all the cabarets looking for his mother, and wants to be left alone to do it. The other boys refuse to leave him.

138.heading: Television.

139.heading: Television.
139.title: "They Say Watching Too Much TV Makes You Passive"
139.author: Jim Davis.

140.heading: Television.
140.title: "Think of What I Could Do with a Dozen Pantries"
140.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood sees a chateau on television that has a dozen pantries.

141.heading: Television.
141.title: "Too Bad For You, Dad. When You Were A Kid You Missed All This!"
141.author: by Mort Walker and Dik Browne
141.appears_in: p. 116 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: The twins are enjoying an old movie on television and talking about their favorite actors and actresses: Charlie Chaplin, Buster Keaton, Fred Astaire, Cary Grant, John Wayne, Greer Garson and Katharine Hepburn.

142.heading: Television.
142.title: "Too Sophisticated to be Frightened by a Scary Face Anymore"
142.author: Bell-Lundy.
notes: Summary: Science fiction has gotten more intellectual, she says, watching television with a mud pack on her face; he, unshaven and bleary-eyed, agrees. Examples used are Millennium and The X-Files.

143.heading: Television.
143.title: "Tricksy, World's Greatest Stunt Man"
143.author: Henry Boltinoff
notes: Begins: "They do it on TV. Why can't I"

144.heading: Television.
144.title: "Turning on the TV"
144.author: Stan & Dan
144.appears_in: 1 p. in My Girl Pearl, no. 5 (July 1957)
notes: Second story.
Begins: Gosh, I've got nothing to do tonight, ... I. Lee, Stan. II. De Carlo, Dan. k. TV. k. Television. Call no.: PN6728.2.M3M86no.5

145.heading: Television.
145.title: "Until We Picked Up Your TV Broadcasts!"
145.author: Tom Wilson.
notes: Summary: The space aliens had hoped to find intelligent life on Earth.

146.heading: Television.
146.title: "Wait, I'll See Which Channel They're Watching"
146.author: by George Clark.
notes: Summary: A TV program rating service is on the phone; she has two dogs watching television.

147.heading: Television.
147.title: "We Have an Anniversary Coming Up Soon, Don't We?"
147.author: Hoest
147.appears_in: p. 11 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Leroy and Loretta are watching boxing on television.

148.heading: Television.

150.heading: Television.
150.title: "What's On TV At This Hour?"
150.author: by Allison Barrows.
notes: Summary: The kids are up early to make the most of summer vacation.

151.heading: Television.
151.title: "Who Cares if the Stupid Dog Will Never Know Who Killed the Butler?"
151.author: Dick Cavalli.
notes: Summary: Winthrop is watching a murder mystery in TV, so Chips has to go to the store.

152.heading: Television.
152.title: "You are a Bolshevik Weenie if you Don't Vote for Senator Glump"
152.author: Breathed
152.appears_in: p. 17 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: The television is telling people what to do.

153.heading: Television.
153.title: "You're Going to Go Deaf"
153.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: Gene pretends he can't hear when Arlo tells him to turn down the TV.

154.heading: Television.
154.title: "You're Living Life Inside a TV Screen"
154.author: by Brian Basset.
notes: Summary: Adam's being told he's seriously dependent on television.
